image.altText: A police vehicle on the far side of the road

props.synopsis: South Australian police say a man is in hospital after he became unresponsive while being arrested in Adelaide's east in the early hours of this morning.

title.children: Man in hospital after becoming unresponsive during attempted arrest, SA Police say

image.altText: A road train drives down a road underneath orange street lights. Shops line the street.

props.synopsis: As the SA government prepares to hand down its last budget before a state election, it recognises a need to build a bypass to take trucks off Adelaide roads — but how much is it willing to spend?

title.children: Long-awaited Adelaide freight bypass hits crossroad in funding tussle

image.altText: A smiling, middle-aged man in a dark suit poses for a corporate-style headshot.

props.synopsis: A South Australian councillor says he will appeal to the ombudsman after colleagues called on him to quit his position for refusing to acknowledge Welcome to Country ceremonies.

title.children: Councillor refuses to resign after Welcome to Country snub

image.altText: Emergency vehicles near the wreckage of a truck and other destroyed vehicles on a stretch of highway in the countryside.

props.synopsis: A multi-vehicle crash on the Western Highway in Victoria has been described by police as "absolute carnage".

title.children: Two Victorians, SA man identified as victims of highway crash

image.altText: A composit image of an aerial of a flooded landscape and an image of dry landcape with a lone tree.

props.synopsis: There are signs a major climate driver could shift into its wet phase over the coming months, boosting the chance of rain across large parts of Australia toward the end of winter.

title.children: After autumn of extremes, climate driver could bring late winter rain

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: A coroner has called for SA Police to change its operating practices after a "high need detainee requiring medical attention" deteriorated while he was left alone in his cell for 41 minutes, after officers decided he needed an ambulance.

title.children: Detainee left alone in cell suffers cardiac arrest waiting for ambulance

image.altText: A dry paddock in south west victoria

props.synopsis: Drought-stricken parts of southern Australia, including Melbourne and Adelaide, are bracing for an increased spike in bushfire risk this winter, according to a new report.

title.children: Dried-out southern regions face increased winter fire risk

image.altText: Elon Musk stands in front of a screen and waves.

props.synopsis: A proposal to build a Tesla factory in Adelaide's south is one step closer, despite 95 per cent of respondents to the local council's public consultation opposing the plan.

title.children: Council progresses plan for Tesla battery factory, despite 'anti-Elon' sentiment

image.altText: Identical twins Danny and Michael Philippou pose for a photo, making funny faces in front of a neutral background.

props.synopsis: Aussie directors Danny and Michael Philippou are behind the $143 million smash-hit Talk to Me, but they won't be switching Adelaide for Hollywood. Now they're back with a gory new feature, once again exploring the horrors of teen life in suburbia.

title.children: Why Aussie directors behind $143m smash-hit won't be moving to Hollywood

image.altText: A woman in a hooded jacket covers her face after a court appearance.

props.synopsis: A manslaughter charge has been dropped against a South Australian woman over the death of her six-year-old daughter. Instead, she has pleaded guilty to three charges of criminal neglect. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the first name and image of a person who has died.

title.children: SA mother pleads guilty to criminal neglect over death of 6yo daughter

image.altText: A man surrounded by emergency service workers holding a blanket and plastic bags.

props.synopsis: Emergency services have rescued a man from the bottom of a deep cave in the centre of a regional South Australian city.

title.children: Man pulled to safety after getting stuck in 30m deep sinkhole

image.altText: A drone picture of Adelaide's Sam Way building, with other CBD buildings nearby.

props.synopsis: A former senior member of a South Australian church has been jailed and told he "should've known better" when he sexually assaulted a 14-year-old girl in the early 2000s.

title.children: 'Should've known better': Former senior church member sentenced for teen sex assault

image.altText: A headshot of James Bailie.

props.synopsis: Harvard University's Australian students' group chat is often focused on picnics and pub nights. But it's now blowing up with talk about the Trump administration's sudden move to end their enrolment.

title.children: Australians in limbo as Trump says Harvard's 'getting their ass kicked'

image.altText: Man with black hat and grey shirt with arm around a brown pony as it eats from a bucket.

props.synopsis: South Australian farmers say "there's no hay" in the state, and where it is available, it has reached unsustainable prices amid ongoing drought conditions.

title.children: 'No hay' in South Australia casting doubt over farming future

image.altText: A smiling, middle-aged woman with shoulder-length hair cuddles up with a smiling, fair-haired young man.

props.synopsis: Pauline Sowry's family last saw the Illawarra woman in December 1993. Several years since the cold case was reopened, a man has been arrested.

title.children: Man arrested 30 years after disappearance of NSW mother

image.altText: An image of Erin Patterson.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson is accused of murdering three of her relatives by serving them a beef Wellington lunch which contained death cap mushrooms. Follow the trial live.

title.children: Defence cross-examines police witness in Erin Patterson trial

image.altText: Several people standing in a line and holding a large Russian flag.

props.synopsis: Vladamir Putin's forces took control of the Ukrainian city of Mariupol three years ago. For the residents who didn't flee, life there has changed significantly, but speaking out can be deadly.

title.children: After Russia captured this city, its new rulers started taking houses

image.altText: Anthony Albanese pointing at press conference

props.synopsis: The prime minister has lashed out at one of the country's leading security think tanks and demanded it "have a look at themselves" after it warned Australia could be left with a "brittle and hollowed defence force" if military funding was not increased.

title.children: PM tells think tank to 'have a look at themselves' after defence report

image.altText: Richard Boyle speaks to supporters outside court.

props.synopsis: Australian Taxation Office (ATO) whistleblower Richard Boyle has pleaded guilty to four charges including taping private conversations without consent.

title.children: ATO whistleblower Richard Boyle pleads guilty to four charges

image.altText: Wadumbah dance group members James Webb, his son Terrence Webb and grandson Stanley Webb, posing for a photo.

props.synopsis: James Webb has been performing traditional Aboriginal dance for over 30 years, but it has always been about more than just the show for his Wadumbah dance group.

title.children: Dispelling 'all the crazy myths' drives this Aboriginal dance group

image.altText: A woman holding fabric shopping bags while others are on a rack and on hooks

props.synopsis: Jody McKechnie's concerns about plastic use spurred her to start the 10,000 Bag Project. With the help of the local community she has achieved her goal.

title.children: Volunteer makes 10,000 free fabric shopping bags to fight waste

image.altText: Woodside future - North Rankin

props.synopsis: When all the hype and the fury are stripped away, the decision to extend the life of the gigantic North West Shelf LNG plant boils down to one thing — enabling the Browse gas project off the Kimberley coast.

title.children: Woodside approval paves the way for the mother of all climate battles

image.altText: Woman in foreground and man looking towards her.

props.synopsis: The opposition now has two months to settle down internal tensions before parliament resumes. When it does, the prime minister won't be giving them an inch.

title.children: Ley and Littleproud's game of snakes and ladders has made powerful frenemies

image.altText: Jade Young, 47, was fatally stabbed at Westfield Bondi Junction on Saturday, April 13, 2024

props.synopsis: The mother of Jade Young, who was killed in the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing, says she thinks some people who have appeared at the coronial inquest "have lost [the] fact that six much-loved people are dead, murdered".

title.children: Bondi Junction stabbing victim 'failed by multiple systems', mother says

image.altText: Senior Warlpiri elder Ned Jampijinpa Hargraves speaking to the media outside the NT Supreme Court.

props.synopsis: The grandfather of the 24-year-old man who died in police custody in Alice Springs on Tuesday has paid tribute to his grandson and called for "accountability, justice and self-determination".

title.children: Grandfather calls for 'answers and justice' over 24yo's death in custody

image.altText: A crowd of people outside a white sheet metal building

props.synopsis: Four Palestinians have died after a UN food hub was stormed by hundreds of desperate Gazans, according to hospital officials.

title.children: Health officials say four Gazans dead after UN food warehouse stormed

image.altText: Sydney renter Sarah sitting in a stairwell

props.synopsis: Luis Alberto Cancino Mena placed female housemates under surveillance without their knowledge or consent. Now one of the victims is telling her story.

title.children: 'Form of violence against women': Man secretly films female housemates in bathroom

image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Heartbreaking social media posts show the pain of Pheobe Bishop's family as they search for answers two weeks after her disappearance.

title.children: Family's heartbreak as two weeks pass without news of missing teen

image.altText: Benicio Del Toro and Mia Threapleton look grumpy after a plane crash in The Phoenician Scheme

props.synopsis: While The Phoenician Scheme has the ingredients of an Anderson classic, it's missing the heart, nuance and grounding that made his early films so special.

title.children: Wes Anderson's latest film feels like a parody of his own work

image.altText: A man with an eyebrow piercing and moustache

props.synopsis: James Wood is accused of possessing a shortened firearm and ammunition in the house he shared with missing Queensland teenager Pheobe Bishop.

title.children: Second housemate of Pheobe Bishop charged with unrelated weapons offences

image.altText: Female doctor wearing blue shirt and jacket looking through a microscope in a lab.

props.synopsis: A shortage of forensic pathologists in New South Wales is delaying court matters, including murder trials, by up to 18 months.

title.children: Forensic pathology wait time 'blowout' delays murder trials

image.altText: A family photo showing  an Indian mother and father holding a young boy and standing next to an older girl on an green backdrop

props.synopsis: Jagdish Patel, his wife Vaishaliben, their daughter Vihangi and son Dharmik died in a -38 degree Celsius blizzard after walking for hours trying to find a car to take them into the United States.

title.children: People smuggler jailed after family freeze to death on US border

image.altText: An Instagram post confirming that Manawa Aranui had re-signed with a netball team in Victoria.

props.synopsis: A netballer has hit back at an opposition club after being deemed ineligible to play for the rest of the season due to their superior "stamina and physique".

title.children: Gender-diverse netballer removed from country leagues

image.altText: Starry and nebula-filled sky with pointer highlighting and labelling the location of ASKAP J1832.

props.synopsis: A weird object in the sky that blasted pulses of X-rays and radio waves for two minutes out of every 44 could be a dead star, but it's not one that fits with astronomical theories.

title.children: Discovery of flashing cosmic object deepens space mystery
